they don't slouch on the menu either, though i was too busy floating in the beer sampler to give the food much of a chance.  for any non-beer drinkers or for any beer drinkers with bottomless bellies, the oatmeal stout milkshake is a must-have.
Great beer, great food, fun place. Always busy for happy hour and on weekends, be prepared to wait.

Great food and a great atmosphere. The manager actually hung out with us before our meal came. The elk burger was fantastic. We enjoy eating at local places and we were not disappointed here! I love the old building that was built in 1892. Service was great! I can't say enough about this place. If you are looking for a great local restaurant this is the place!

Been here a couple of times while visiting from New York and haven't been disappointed yet. Nice selection of brews on tap along with an anything but typical menu plus I've always been able to catch my game of choice.  Exactly what I was looking for.
Thanks Yelpers!

It was really hard to find parking spot. I had to park and took a 15 minutes walk till I get to four peak. I ordered the local burger, the burger was way too dry and they added too much mustard onto it made me sneeze, but the French fries were great.

On a recent trip to Tempe from Orange County, CA, my friends and I decided to try out Four Peaks for our only lunch of our stay. We parked down the street because there was either little or no private parking for the brewery. It was a short walk that seemed like it took forever in the 100 degree weather. 

When we reached the hostess stand we were relieved to finally get an ice old beer and enjoy our mini-vacay. However, when the security checked our IDs we were not allowed to go in. Being from California, we hold vertical IDs until we turn 22 (unless you wish to go to the DMV to change it early). In Arizona, state law invalidates vertical IDs 30 days after your 21st birthday. 

Despite our protests that we are from California, security would not let us in. 

We went to a nice restaurant after that, across from ASU. Upon ordering drinks there, the waiter told us that despite our vertical CA IDs, we are allowed to drink because it is not a federal law, it's only a AZ state law...

I know this review seems extensive, but we were disappointed to say the least with Four Peaks.

The vibe is cool. Typical brewery style. The two times I have been, the food has been great. The wait is always super long to get in on the weekends but I can understand why. It has that sports bar feel, and their delicious beer available as well.

If you love beer, you love breweries, this is the best one in AZ!!! 

Four Peaks has a wonderful menu but an even better beer selection. Be on the lookout for seasonal favorites like the pumpkin porter or Imperial Russian Stout as they sell out fast. 

This location can get busy during the weekends and sometimes late at night. It's a place you can relax, hang with friends and enjoy some good eats.

My favorite thing to order is the oatmeal stout shake. If you thought beer and milkshakes can't be friends, well you are mistaken. The beer compliments the shake so perfectly that it isn't too sweet, it's just right! Our favorite appetizer is the blackened chicken nachos. It's a large portion so be prepared to share with at least 3 other people or prepare for leftovers.

So come and enjoy a beer, you won't regret it!

Having just moved to Scottsdale, I had seen Four Peaks brews at local restaurants and couldn't wait to try it. My bf and I visited the brewery after a long day at the Phoenix Zoo. The location was easy to find with plenty of street parking (although it could be difficult during peak hours). We found a nice table on the half-indoor seating area. The ambiance was very cool, with a converted loft warehouse sort of feel.

The bf had the beer sampler, which I helped myself to some sips of. I ordered a pint of the Kilt Lifter, which was a great deal during happy hour. Next, I tried the Pumpkin Porter (full price, even during happy hour). Foodwise, I had the pub fish and chips, which are battered in Kilt Lifter, and the bf had the french dip. Both items were on par with good quality pub fare.

Kilt Lifter: great medium brew, very smooth. The type of beer you could drink every day and never tire of. Pumpkin Porter: we loved it so much, we purchased a growler so we could take some home! Note: there is an extra charge for filling up a growler with a seasonal brew. $4 for the growler itself, $10 for beer, and $5 seasonal charge. Normal refills of growlers are $10.

I am a beer lover. I have spent time living in Munich and drinking some of the best beers in the world. You can't go wrong with Four Peaks brews. Next stop, North Scottsdale location. Closer to home and hopefully just as great!

Best place in Tempe to grab a beer and killer bar food. The nachos here are life changing. No meat, blackened chicken, or ground beef, it doesn't matter. They are so addicting! The beer flight is perfect for when I bring out of town guests who have never had their beer. Even when it is really busy, you can usually find a place at the bar pretty quickly. The only thing I would change is the parking situation, but that can happen when an establishment is THAT good!

I've heard the food is excellent but in this trip it was just beer for me. I got to a flight to try them all out and really appreciated their flagship "Kiltlifter" beer. It's a full and tasty beer that doesn't leave anything to the imagination. Their peach beer was also excellent since it tasted like the peaches were the precise ripeness. Not too sugary yet sweet enough to want another sip. Can't praise them enough. A little bit noisy in the dining area but that's a sign of happy customers.

BAM! It's simply the best. I've eaten here for years. Ever since they opened up as a matter of fact. It's a favorite for Soccer matches and when I need a good beer and something special for my tummy.
The Calamari is great along with everything else.
I can satisfy myself just on apps and beer.
I suggest getting there early. It can fill up pretty fast and no one likes waiting in the sun.

Have had great food brew and service here before. This time made plans to go meet some friends with my underage brother. Called ahead to ensure he could get in with me, manager approved. When we arrived he was denied access, and the bouncer very clearly lied to us in order to avoid a larger ordeal. I called the manager again, this time he denied us. Would have been fine had they not told us we could get in the first time. Wasted time  because of poor communication and inconsiderate employees.

Probably my favorite place to go in Tempe. Great Beer made on site and the best "bar" menu out there. There daily specials are always awesome and usually temp me into visiting more time than I should. My favorite plave to take out of town guests.

Gets super busy, especially for happy hour, of course.

Once you get a seat, though, you'll be happy for much more than just an hour.

Delicious beer and cocktails, yummy small plates and entrees, there's something for everyone.

This was a nice pit stop as I was passing through Phoenix. Their peach ale was amazing as were the beer battered fries! Only had an hour to eat and the service was quick which was very convenient! The only thing was that towards the end, the waitress didn't come back as much and didn't ask if we liked the food. But besides that, it was a quick refuel and it was tasty!
